questions.clue: This wonder was located in the city of Babylon and is often depicted with lush terraces.
Built as a tomb for Pharaoh Khufu, this is the only wonder still in existence today.
This Greek statue, made by Phidias, was located in Olympia and honored a famous god.
Standing at the entrance of a harbor, this wonder was a giant bronze statue of the sun god Helios.
This mausoleum, built for Mausolus, a satrap of the Persian Empire, was located in a city now part of Turkey.
This novel begins with 'Call me Ishmael.'
Identify the book that starts with 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.'
This dystopian novel starts with 'It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.'
The novel that begins with 'All children, except one, grow up.'
This classic novel opens with 'You don't know about me without you have read a book by the name of The Adventures of Tom Sawyer; but that ain't no matter.'
In 1969, this mission made history as the first successful manned moon landing.
This reusable spacecraft, first launched in 1981, revolutionized space travel by reducing costs.
This space telescope, launched in 1990, has provided some of the most detailed images of the universe.
This Mars rover, which landed in 2012, has been exploring the Gale Crater to study the planet's habitability.
Launched in 2021, this space telescope is designed to succeed Hubble with advanced infrared capabilities.
This staple Italian dish, known for its dough base and various toppings, is often cooked in a wood-fired oven.
Sushi, a popular Japanese dish, is often made with this type of raw fish served on vinegared rice.
Paella, a traditional dish from Valencia, Spain, typically features this type of rice cooked with saffron.
In Thailand, this spicy and sour soup is often made with shrimp, lemongrass, and galangal.
This French dish, known for its slow-cooked beef in red wine sauce, is a specialty of the Burgundy region.
This artist painted the famous ceiling of the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City.
This 'Last Supper' artist is also known for his detailed notebooks filled with inventions and sketches.
His 'School of Athens' fresco in the Vatican celebrates the Classical spirit of the Renaissance.
This Northern Renaissance painter is famous for his detailed and symbolic works, including 'The Arnolfini Portrait'.
Titian, a master of color, was a prominent figure of the Venetian School and painted this mythological work, 'Bacchus and Ariadne'.

final.clue: This 1925 novel, set in the fictional towns of West Egg and East Egg, critiques the American Dream and is narrated by a character named Nick Carraway.
